summary: Federal agencies have established requirements to protect workers and the public against cancer and other harmful effects associated with low doses of radiation exposure. We testified that federal agencies have generally used the advice of scientific advisory bodies to develop and apply these requirements. Additionally, for fiscal years 2012 through 2016, the Department of Energy and other federal agencies obligated about $210 million for research...
title: Low-Dose Radiation: Interagency Collaboration on Planning Research Could Improve Information on Health Effects
